description: This trap is sent when a test which is not associated with a
measurement fails. This trap is triggered by the transition of
the '...State' or '...TestState' object associated with the
test to the 'fail' state from any other state.
Transmission of the trap is subject to rate control and to the
enable status of each test.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::testFailTrap DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlOID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlGenerationTime s EXAMPLEE DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlFailureSummary b 0 DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapInput i 9999

description: In the case of a testFailTrap or a measurementFailTrap, this
object holds the OID of the '...State' or '...TestState' object
whose transition to 'fail' has triggered the trap.
In the case of a measurementUnknownTrap, this object holds the
OID of the '...MeasurementState' object whose transition to
'unknown' has triggered the trap.
This object is present for the formal purpose of defining the
variable bindings returned with the traps. It is not accessible
for normal reading.
variables.name: DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlOID

description: In the case of a testFailTrap or a measurementFailTrap
at the moment when the trap is generated, the value of
the '...LatestError' object associated with the test which
caused the trap is copied here. In the case of a
measurementUnknownTrap, the time at which the measurement
became unknown is copied here.
This object is present for the formal purpose of defining
the variable bindings returned with the traps. It is not
accessible for normal reading.
variables.name: DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlGenerationTime

description: This bit string contains a summary of all the test failures.
If the bit for the test is set to one, that test is in a
fail state.
When a trap is being generated, the agent should ensure that
this information is as up to date as possible, without
causing undue delay in sending the trap.
variables.name: DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlFailureSummary

description: The Transport Stream input whose change triggered the
current trap. This information can also be obtained by
analysing the trapControlOID, but trapInput provides the
information directly.
This object is present for the formal purpose of defining
the variable bindings returned with the traps. It is not
accessible for normal reading.
variables.name: DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapInput

description: Trap which is sent when a test which is associated with a
measurement fails. This trap is triggered by the transition
of the '...State' or '...TestState' object associated with
the test to the 'fail' state from any other state.
Transmission of the trap is subject to rate control and to
the enable status of each test.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::measurementFailTrap DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlOID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlGenerationTime s EXAMPLEE DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlMeasurementValue s EXAMPLE DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlFailureSummary b 0 DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapInput i 9999

description: In the case of a testFailTrap or a measurementFailTrap, this
object holds the OID of the '...State' or '...TestState' object
whose transition to 'fail' has triggered the trap.
In the case of a measurementUnknownTrap, this object holds the
OID of the '...MeasurementState' object whose transition to
'unknown' has triggered the trap.
This object is present for the formal purpose of defining the
variable bindings returned with the traps. It is not accessible
for normal reading.
variables.name: DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlOID

description: In the case of a testFailTrap or a measurementFailTrap
at the moment when the trap is generated, the value of
the '...LatestError' object associated with the test which
caused the trap is copied here. In the case of a
measurementUnknownTrap, the time at which the measurement
became unknown is copied here.
This object is present for the formal purpose of defining
the variable bindings returned with the traps. It is not
accessible for normal reading.
variables.name: DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlGenerationTime

description: At the moment when a measurementFailTrap is generated
the value of this object is set from the '...Value' object
associated with the measurement which caused the trap.
Where a measurement returns multiple values, the value
which is copied here is the one which is compared with the
threshold(s) to generate the test result. The measurement
units are the same as those of the source object.
This object is present for the formal purpose of defining
the variable bindings returned with the traps. It is not
accessible for normal reading.
variables.name: DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlMeasurementValue

description: This bit string contains a summary of all the test failures.
If the bit for the test is set to one, that test is in a
fail state.
When a trap is being generated, the agent should ensure that
this information is as up to date as possible, without
causing undue delay in sending the trap.
variables.name: DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlFailureSummary

description: The Transport Stream input whose change triggered the
current trap. This information can also be obtained by
analysing the trapControlOID, but trapInput provides the
information directly.
This object is present for the formal purpose of defining
the variable bindings returned with the traps. It is not
accessible for normal reading.
variables.name: DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapInput

description: Trap which is sent when a measurement value becomes
unavailable. This trap is triggered by the transition of
the '...MeasurementState' object associated with the
measurement to the 'unknown' state from any other state.
Transmission of the trap is subject to rate control.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::measurementUnknownTrap DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlOID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlGenerationTime s EXAMPLEE DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapControlFailureSummary b 0 DVB-MGTR101290-MIB::trapInput i 9999
